response.answer_text: As I checked, I could never find SAR value associated for laptops as in case of a Smart phone. But using a laptop exposes you to Electromagnetic Fields (or EMFs)–basically radio waves that emanate from electronic devices and create a magnetic field. these can be refereed as "Laptop radiation" (though not technically). If you’ve ever sat with a laptop on your knees, you know that your laptop can produce a lot of heat–and the longer you use it, the hotter it gets. The heat can get uncomfortable, but most people don’t realize the heat radiating from your laptop can actually damage your skin. Researchers say the skin discoloration can be permanent, and in rare cases it can cause damage leading to certain skin cancers. Though nowadays laptops manufactures are building laptop as according to the standard specifications, so one can be li'l relaxed in case of a normal usage. Blocking the heat from your laptop can be equally important for male fertility. The heat produced by laptops is definitely not sperm-friendly. If you want healthy sperm count, keep that laptop heat away! If laptop radiation has the capability of causing changes on a cellular level in our bodies–even if this doesn’t cause immediate and obvious harm–then I’m a little concerned about what this means over the long-term. Jokes apart, don’t worry. Three ways to reduce Laptop Radiation exposure are: 1. Stop using your laptop. Yeah, I know, that’s sort of pointing out the obvious. And chances are, you probably don’t want to give up your laptop. (Heck, I’m about to invest in a laptop for myself so I can take blogging on the road with me when I need to.) So for most of us, this isn’t a realistic option–but since technically it is an option, I had to say it. 2. Get the laptop off your lap. All right, here’s your next piece of obvious advice: don’t use your laptop on your lap. Sit at a desk or table instead and treat it like a “normal” computer. 3. Use a high quality laptop shield. Okay, okay, I really do get it. You’re probably using a laptop, and chances are it’s on your lap (that’s what they’re made for, right?). There’s actually a simple solution for reducing your direct exposure to laptop radiation if you prefer to sit with your laptop directly in your lap: a laptop shield. It’s not a complicated or bulky device, just a simple pad engineered and tested to be an effective barrier between you and laptop radiation.
